alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 12:44PM PST until January 09 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible within the entire Watch area. Areas of most concern include urban roads and freeways, and in creeks and streams. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, San Luis Obispo County Beaches, San Luis Obispo County Inland Central Coast, San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys, San Luis Obispo County Mountains, Santa Lucia Mountains and Southern Salinas Valley. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying areas. Rock slides and mud slides may become a significant problem. In addition, the Salinas River at Paso Robles is expected to exceed monitor stage by 5 PM PST this afternoon, peaking at around 24 feet this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong Pacific storm system will bring periods of widespread heavy rainfall with rates between one half and one inch per hour, possibly higher near thunderstorms and favored foothill areas. Rainfall totals of 2 to 5 inches are expected in coastal and valley areas, with 4 to 8 inches expected in the foothills and mountains. Local rainfall totals over 10 inches are possible. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop or if evacuations are ordered.
